meanings.definition: The process of reflecting light or sound back in the direction from which it came.
meanings.sent1: The retroreflection of the car's headlights made them shine brightly back at the driver.
meanings.sent2: The road signs are designed for retroreflection, ensuring they are visible at night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel enjoyed causing retroreflection by bouncing light off the shiny acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted like a retroreflection, brightening up the room with its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The retroreflection of the mirror made the room appear larger and more inviting.

meanings.definition: The act of reflecting an image or signal back towards its source.
meanings.sent1: The retroreflection of the camera flash startled the photographer with its sudden brightness.
meanings.sent2: The satellite dish was positioned for optimal retroreflection of signals from space.
meanings.sent3: The playful cat caused retroreflection by bouncing the laser pointer off the walls.
meanings.sent4: His words were a retroreflection of her own thoughts, echoing back to her with clarity.
meanings.sent5: The retroreflection of the mirror ball created a dazzling display of lights on the dance floor.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of light bouncing off a surface and returning to the original source.
meanings.sent1: The retroreflection of the flashlight off the mirror caught his attention in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The safety vests have retroreflection to make workers visible in low light conditions.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved creating retroreflection to make objects seem to disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a form of retroreflection, spreading joy back to those around her.
meanings.sent5: The retroreflection of the lighthouse beacon guided ships safely through the night.
